{{Han compound|鬲|t1=cauldron|蟲|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}.

===Etymology===
“Hot air; steam; heat” > “to melt” > “to blend”.

Sino-Tibetan; compare {{cog|my|လောင်||to burn; to be burnt; to scorch}}. Related to {{och-l|蟲|hot; hot air; hot weather}} (as in {{och-l|蟲蟲}}), {{och-l|爞|hot weather}} and possibly the word family of  *''lVm'': {{och-l|焰|fire}}.

It belongs to a word family comprised of characters meaning “to melt, to smelt, to fuse, to dissolve”. In modern times the various characters have taken on their specialised meanings:

* {{och-l|融|to melt (at normal temperature); to blend}}
* {{och-l|鎔|to smelt; to melt (at a high temperature)}}
* {{och-l|熔|to smelt; to melt (at a high temperature)}}
* {{och-l|溶|to dissolve (in a liquid)}}
